;;2023-11-14T04:45:46Z;
;

;调查人员已确定，周末火灾是人为纵火所致，这场火灾严重损坏了洛杉矶市中心高速公路的一段高架路段，导致其无限期停火。加州官员周一表示，该州关闭了该工厂，并为长期交通混乱奠定了基础。

;

;纵火案的发现是在加州州长加文·纽瑟姆(Gavin Newsom)透露该州最近提起诉讼要求驱逐该州租赁存储空间的公司之际进行的。周六早些时候起火的圣莫尼卡高速公路下方的房产。

;

;但州长没有表示纵火调查与驱逐行动或该州指控的任何违反租约有关。< /p>;

;纽森和州消防队长 Daniel Berlant 告诉记者，调查人员仍在寻找纵火者的身份，他们呼吁公众帮助找出责任人。

;

;伯兰特说，调查人员“已经能够自信地确定火灾是由纵火引起的”。他拒绝透露更多有关调查人员如何得出结论或起火的精确程度的细节。

;

;每天约有 30 万辆汽车在圣莫尼卡高速公路上行驶，洛杉矶市中心在正常情况下经常拥堵，因此需要绕道行驶。关闭带来的影响预计将波及整个大都市区并加剧交通拥堵。

;

;此次关闭是该地区自 1994 年北岭地震摧毁同一条高速公路两部分以来最严重的交通中断之一，可能会导致整个大都市区的交通拥堵。市长凯伦·巴斯 (Karen Bass) 表示，这种情况持续了几天或更长时间。

;

;交通部总经理劳拉·鲁比奥-科尔内霍 (Laura Rubio-Cornejo) 表示，驾车者似乎大多在意建议他们避开市中心街道并使用公共交通或工作的建议尽可能从家里出发。

;

;卢比奥-科尔内霍说：“拥堵情况比平时要好一些。”

;

;即便如此，周一市中心及其周边地区的道路仍然拥堵，据当地媒体报道，即使是轻微的交通事故也可能很快引发交通堵塞。

;

;受损的高速公路路段（也称为东西向 10 号州际公路或“10 号公路”）于 2 日双向封闭。另外两条高速公路之间的一个点对于游览洛杉矶至关重要，在洛杉矶开车出行是常态。

;

;火焰损坏了 100 多根支撑柱和高速公路甲板，并蔓延到高速公路下方的存储场当局称，立交桥上堆满了成堆的木托盘、集装箱和停放的车辆。

;

;工程师分析了受损结构中的混凝土和钢筋样本，以确定高速公路受损部分是否可以安全修复或需要纽瑟姆表示，初步取样显示高速公路桥面的结构完整性“似乎比最初评估的要坚固得多”，最终测试结果决定了如何预计周二早些时候将继续进行。

;

;纽瑟姆确认了被烧毁的高速公路下国有财产的承租人为 Apex Development Inc，该公司总部位于加利福尼亚州卡拉巴萨斯，洛杉矶北部。

;

;他说该公司已停止支付租金，并违反了租赁条款，包括未经授权将空间转租给多达五个其他实体。

;

;州长表示预计将举行法庭听证会一月或二月，州政府提交非法拘留者驱逐通知。 Apex 周一没有立即回应路透社的置评请求。

;

;Bass 表示，没有迹象表明火灾与附近约 16 人的无家可归者营地之间存在联系。

;

;Newsom周日宣布;洛杉矶县进入紧急状态;，以加快高速公路的维修速度。在视察受损情况时，州长发誓要尽快重新开放高速公路。

;

;北岭地震发生后，在向承包商提供报价后，高速公路在大约三个月内重新开放，比原计划提前了 74 天据《洛杉矶时报》报道，如果工作提前完成，每天将获得 20 万美元的奖金。

;

;纽瑟姆表示，最新项目正在考虑类似的激励措施。

;;美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦在美国主办的亚太经合组织（APEC）会议之前与中国国务院副总理何立峰会面后出席新闻发布会-太平洋经济合作组织）峰会，美国加利福尼亚州旧金山，2023 年 11 月 10 日。路透社/卡洛斯·巴里亚/档案照片;
;

;美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦周一表示，将就贸易部分进行谈判印度-太平洋经济框架的目标需要进一步开展工作，这对拜登政府来说是一次挫折，拜登政府原本希望在本周宣布实质性成果。

;

;耶伦在新闻发布会上表示，三项工作已经取得了“非常重大的进展”这是 14 个 IPEF 成员国正在讨论的四个领域中的一个，但在贸易方面还存在“剩余问题”。

;

;这是拜登政府深化与亚洲国家经济关系并对抗中国日益崛起的主导地位的努力的核心。在太平洋地区，IPEF 是一个多边谈判论坛，旨在在包括贸易在内的一系列领域达成协议。

;

;她表示，贸易支柱方面已经取得了“重大进展”，“但看起来并没有取得进展”。是完整的，就像可能需要进一步工作的事情一样。”

;

;“我的理解是，四大支柱中的三个已经取得了非常实质性的进展，”她指的是供应链谈判、气候转型和反腐败。

;

;耶伦的言论与熟悉谈判的人士的看法一致，他们告诉路透社，有关改善劳工和环境标准以及执行合规方法的谈判已经进行遭到一些成员国的抵制。

;

;拜登政府原本希望在本周亚太经合组织(APEC)国家领导人齐聚旧金山之际宣布贸易支柱方面的一些成果。

;< p>;美国总统乔·拜登;渴望描绘 IPEF< /a>; 为成员国（主要是亚太经合组织成员国）带来有意义的成果，因为他寻求为亚洲提供一个由美国主导的替代方案，以加深与中国的经济联系。

;

;IPEF 谈判的目的从来都不是为了减少与中国的经济联系。关税或改善成员的市场准入，其中许多成员是前总统唐纳德·特朗普于 2017 年放弃的跨太平洋伙伴关系贸易协议的签署国。

;

;熟悉谈判的人士表示，宣布结果更重要可能涉及 IPEF 的清洁能源合作和反腐败支柱。

;

;IPEF 的四个“支柱”中只有一个关于加强供应链的内容;一份完整的文本;，其中包括 5 月份就潜在供应中断（如大流行后经历的情况）的预警系统达成的协议，以及一个就涉及国家安全或关键经济部门等供应链问题进行磋商的委员会。

;

;耶伦表示，她担心中国的工业产能过剩，这可能会导致全球市场充斥着商品，而北京方面正在寻求解决办法为了提振疲软的经济增长，她说上周在旧金山与中国国务院副总理何立峰讨论了这些问题。

;

;“我们确实讨论了工业领域已经出现和未来可能出现的供应过剩问题中国正在大力投资。我确实认为这是一种风险。”耶伦说道。

;

;耶伦补充道，双方都同意美国和中国应该寻求公平贸易关系和公平的竞争环境，以便两国公司能够竞争。

;

;中国在其最近的工业计划中瞄准了先进半导体、飞机、电动汽车、农业设备和其他行业等行业，并最近寻求成为;技术领域自给自足;。

;美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯周一采取行动，回应国务院内部对拜登政府政策日益增长的批评。以色列-哈马斯战争，数百名美国政府雇员公开和私下主张加沙停火。

;

;

;批评集中在乔·拜登总统在战后对以色列坚定不移的支持上哈马斯武装分子 10 月 7 日发动的袭击造成 1,200 人死亡，其中大部分是平民，这是该国历史上最致命的袭击。

;

;作为回应，以色列对加沙发动了无情的军事行动，造成 11,000 多名巴勒斯坦人死亡据加沙卫生部称，数十年之久的以色列-巴勒斯坦冲突掀开了多年来最血腥的一章。

;

;华盛顿拒绝了阿拉伯和巴勒斯坦领导人及其他人呼吁以色列停止袭击的呼吁。哈马斯控制的加沙地带，但它敦促人道主义暂停，以允许更多援助进入并撤离美国人和外国人。

;

;在给国务院雇员的一封电子邮件信中，布林肯刚刚从为期九天的中东和亚洲之行，承认冲突给劳动力造成的情感损失，但也承认队伍内部可能因政策而产生分歧。

;

;“我知道，对于你们中的许多人来说，布林肯在路透社获得的信中表示，这场危机造成的痛苦正在造成严重的个人损失。

;

;“每天看到婴儿、儿童、老人、妇女和儿童的照片，会带来痛苦。其他平民在这场危机中遭受痛苦，令人心痛。我自己也有这种感觉，”他说。

;

;“我也知道部门中的一些人可能不同意我们正在采取的方法，或者对我们可以做得更好的方面有看法。我们在华盛顿组织了论坛来听取您的意见，并敦促经理和团队在世界各地的职位上进行坦诚的讨论，以便我们能够听到您的反馈和想法。我已要求我们的高级领导层继续这样做。”

;

;“我们正在倾听：您分享的内容正在为我们的政策和信息提供信息。”

;

; Tue, 14 Nov 2023 09:55:03 +0800 US buys 1.2 million barrels of oil for Strategic Petroleum Reservehttps://reuters.com/article/usa-oil-reserve/us-plans-to-buy-1-2-million-barrels-of-oil-for-strategic-petroleum-reserve-idUSKBN329020
;;2023-11-14T01:00:06Z;
;;
;;Department of Energy officials lead reporters on a tour of the Strategic Petroleum Reserve in Freeport, Texas, US June 9, 2016. REUTERS/Richard Carson;
;

;WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The US has bought 1.2 million barrels of oil to help replenish the Strategic Petroleum Reserve after selling the largest amount ever from the stockpile last year, the US Energy Department said on Monday.

;

;The department said it bought the oil at an average price of $77.57 a barrel from two companies after 18 bids were submitted.

;

;The administration of President Joe Biden last year conducted the largest ever sale from the SPR of 180 million barrels, part of a strategy to stabilize soaring oil markets and combat high pump prices in the aftermath of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. It has now bought back about 6 million barrels.

;

;As oil prices have risen on production cutbacks by Saudi Arabia and Russia, it has been difficult for the administration to buy back oil for the reserve. Last month it raised the price at which it hopes to buy back oil to $79 or less a barrel, up from an earlier price range of about $68 to $72.

;

;Last month the Energy Department said it hopes to buy 3 million barrels for December delivery and another 3 million for January at the higher price. It said it expects to issue additional oil purchase solicitations for the reserve on a monthly basis through at least May 2024.

;

;“President (Joe) Biden and the Energy Department remain committed to refilling the SPR at fair prices, safeguarding this critical energy security asset while getting a good deal for American taxpayers,” a department spokesperson said.

;

;The department has said oil in last year's emergency sales sold for an average of $95 per barrel.

;;US Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas arrives to testify before the Senate Appropriations committee as lawmakers in the US Congress struggle to reach a deal to head off a looming partial government shutdown less than two weeks away on Capitol Hill in Washington, US, November 8, 2023. REUTERS/Julia Nikhinson/File Photo;
;

;The US House of Representatives voted on Monday to pause the effort to impeach Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas, halting a Republican campaign that alleges he has been derelict in his duty of in managing the US-Mexico border.

;

;The articles of impeachment, introduced by Republican Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene on Thursday, contend that Mayorkas, an appointee of Democratic President Joe Biden, violated his oath of office by failing to constrain the ;record numbers of migrants; arriving at the border.

;

;The House voted to refer the articles back to the House Homeland Security Committee, which is carrying out its own investigation of Mayorkas's alleged dereliction of duty.

;

;The move comes as Congress has less than five days to extend funding or send the US into its fourth partial government shutdown in a decade.

;

;The impeachment comes after months of threats from Republicans, who blame Biden's administration for rolling back harsh restrictions on accepting migrants and asylum seekers put in place under then-President Donald Trump, a Republican.

;

;If the Republican-controlled House impeaches Mayorkas, he will almost definitely be found innocent after a trial in the Senate, which Democrats control by a slim margin.

;

;In response to the initial impeachment motion, a US Department of Homeland Security spokesperson said lawmakers should stop "their reckless impeachment charades and attacks on law enforcement" and instead "deliver desperately needed reforms for our broken immigration system."

;

;Since Biden took office in 2021, US border agents have made more than 5 million arrests of migrants making irregular crossings - that is, not through a controlled border station - over the US-Mexico border. Migrants have arrived from around the world; large numbers have fled economic and political turmoil in Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela.

;

;Both Biden and Trump are seeking another term in office in 2024, with Trump the leading candidate for the Republican nomination.

;

;House Republicans have also launched an impeachment inquiry into Biden. The probe is focused on the president's son, Hunter Biden, and the White House has denied any wrongdoing.

; Tue, 14 Nov 2023 09:25:03 +0800 Biden says Gaza hospitals “must be protected“https://reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians/biden-says-gaza-hospitals-must-be-protected-idUSKBN329022
;;2023-11-14T01:06:52Z;
;;
;;Israeli tanks advanced on Monday (November 13) to the gates of Gaza City's main hospital, a chief target in Israel's battle against Hamas, as US President Joe Biden said hospitals must be protected and he hoped for less intrusive Israeli action.;
;

;US President Joe Biden said hospitals in the Gaza Strip must be protected and he hoped for "less intrusive" action by Israel as Israeli tanks advanced to the gates of the besieged enclave's main hospital.

;

;Israeli tanks have taken up positions outside Al Shifa Hospital, Gaza City's main medical center, which Israel says sits atop of tunnels housing a headquarters for Hamas fighters who are using patients as shields.

;

;Hamas denies the Israeli claim.

;

;Israel launched its war against Hamas after the Islamist Palestinian group's Oct. 7 rampage into southern Israel. Around 1,200 people died in that attack and 240 were dragged to Gaza as hostages according to Israel's tally.

;

;The armed wing of Hamas said it was ready to free up to 70 women and children held in Gaza in ;exchange; for a five-day truce in the war, in which Gaza medical authorities say more than 11,000 people have been confirmed killed, about 40% children.

;

;Roughly two-thirds of the densely populated Mediterranean strip have been made homeless by Israel's military campaign, in which it has ordered the northern half of Gaza evacuated.

;

;Gaza health ministry spokesperson Ashraf Al-Qidra, who was inside Al Shifa hospital, on Monday said 32 patients had died in the previous three days, including ;three newborns;, because of the siege of the hospital in northern Gaza and a lack of power.

;

;The Israeli military said early on Tuesday it had "initiated a humanitarian effort to coordinate transfer of incubators" from Israel to Al Shifa but made clear none of the devices, often used to keep pre-mature newborns warm, had been received by the facility.

;

;There was no immediate comment from Al Shifa or from Hamas.

;

;At least 650 patients were still inside Al Shifa hospital, desperate to be evacuated to another medical facility.

;

;In his first comments since the weekend's events, including patient deaths reported at Al Shifa, Biden said hospitals must be protected.

;

;"My hope and expectation is that there will be less intrusive action relative to hospitals and we remain in contact with the Israelis," Biden told reporters at the White House on Monday.

;

;"Also there is an effort to get this pause to deal with the release of prisoners and that's being negotiated, as well, with the Qataris ... being engaged," he added. "So I remain somewhat hopeful but hospitals must be protected."

;

;Israel launched its campaign last month against Hamas, the Islamist group that runs the Gaza Strip and that is officially dedicated to the destruction of Israel, after Hamas militants invaded southern Israel killing civilians and soldiers.

;

;Israel says Hamas uses hospitals for military purposes and Israel's military on Monday released video and photos of what it said were ;weapons the group stored; in the basement of Rantissi hospital, a pediatric hospital specializing in cancer treatment.

;

;Al-Qassam Brigades, the armed wing of Hamas, posted an audio recording on its Telegram channel saying the group was ready to release as many as 70 women and children hostages in return for a five-day ceasefire, an offer Israel is unlikely to embrace.

;

;"We told the (Qatari) mediators that in a five-day truce, we can release 50 of them and the number could reach 70 due to the difficulty that the captives are held by different factions," said al-Qassam Brigades spokesman Abu Ubaida said, saying Israel had asked for 100 to be freed.

;

;Israel, which effectively blockades Gaza, has rejected a ceasefire, arguing that Hamas would simply use it to regroup, but has permitted brief humanitarian "pauses" to allow food and other supplies to flow in and foreigners to flee.

;

;White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan told reporters Washington would "like to see considerably longer pauses - days, not hours - in the context of a hostage release."

;

;Speaking on condition of anonymity, another US official said the release of dozens of hostages could lead to a several-day pause but said negotiations were extremely delicate.

;

;There was also fighting on Monday at a second major hospital in northern Gaza, al-Quds, which has stopped functioning.

;

;The Palestinian Red Crescent said there was heavy gunfire around the hospital and a convoy to evacuate patients and staff could not get through.

;

;Israel said it killed "approximately 21 terrorists" at al-Quds in return fire after fighters shot from the hospital entrance. It released footage it said showed men at the hospital gate, one of whom appeared to carry a rocket-propelled grenade launcher.

;

;Israel's military and security services also said they had killed a number of Hamas commanders and officials in the last day, including Mohammed Khamis Dababash, who they described as the group's former head of military intelligence.

;

;Hamas media said more than 30 people were killed and scores injured in an Israeli airstrike on the Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza. An Israeli military spokesperson said the army was checking the report on Jabalia.
